result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason Michael Leitzinger

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jason Michael Leitzinger appeared by video, in custody from Dubuque County Jail.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Jason Michael Leitzinger.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bartelt heard on status of case. Court heard. Attorney Pozorksi heard. Court heard and warrant will remain.
Status conference on October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jason Michael Leitzinger appeared by video, in custody from Dubuque County Jail.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Jason Michael Leitzinger.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives reading and stands mute. Court enters not guilty plea(s). Warrant remains. Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jason Michael Leitzinger not in court.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Jason Michael Leitzinger.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. State requests a warrant on defendant's nonappearance. Attorney Bartelt heard. Court finds defendant waives his right to be present for the preliminary hearing due to the defendant's nonappearance. Amy Hartwig sworn and testified. Exhibit #1-received. State asks court to take judicial notice of Iowa County CCAP case 20CF117. No objection from Attorney Bartelt. Notice taken. Cross. Attorney Bartelt waives argument and objects to bind over. Court finds probable cause for bind over. Information filed. Court authorizes warrant.
Preliminary hearing on July 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on July 11, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Jason Michael Leitzinger in court.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Defendant referred to SPD. State requests signature bond. Court heard and orders $1000 signature bond. Status date set.
